alert.note: Alert for Coweta; Meriwether; Pike; Upson (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 25 at 3:39PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Meriwether, western Pike, northwestern Upson and southeastern Coweta Counties through 415 PM EDT... At 339 PM EDT, a line of strong thunderstorms was along a line extending from near Odessadale to near Woodbury to near Sprewell Bluff State Park, and moving north at 35 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Zebulon, Greenville, Grantville, Woodbury, Luthersville, Moreland, Molena, Haralson, Lone Oak, Gay, Rocky Mount, Saint Marks, Raleigh, Hilltop, Odessadale, Hollonville, Alvaton, Harris City, Imlac and Wooster. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
